name: Fall of the Achilles
description:
Months ago, the Republic's flagship, the Achilles, went missing in deep space. Now you've found it—but is that a good thing? It's adrift, with no signs of life. You're a smuggler, and the code in the Achilles' engine could be your biggest score ever. But what if whatever killed the crew of the Achilles targets you next?

This is a Twine mystery/horror game set on a seemingly abandoned starship. It should take about 1 to 2 hours to complete, and has a few different possible paths and endings. While it's a text game, it's designed to mimic a classic adventure game, with a map, an inventory, and an environment you can wander around freely, plus a few not-too-difficult puzzles.

Note: Clicking on the arrow in the top left right off will display the map, which will be very helpful in navigating the game. This game can be played on a phone, but works better on a tablet or a desktop as that leaves more room for the map.

 Warning: This game has mature themes involving violence, murder, and the afterlife, and is also intended to be somewhat creepy at parts.
